question: See ya', Ashley. So I get home today, phone's ringing. It's Hank Wilcox. Callin' for you. What the hell? I said, 'Hank, that's a little bit outta line don't'cha think, a single man callin' someone's wife?' At night, nonetheless.
answer: He's teaching environmental science, Grant. Probably wants to borrow my lesson plans from last semester.

question: Oh yeah, that's what he wants to borrow, this guy.
answer: It's just a work thing.

question: Work thing hell, Starla. He just wants to get in your pussy. Him and most these other ones around here. That's where their minds is at, them sick fucks. I'll tell you, sugarplum, you're lucky you got me. You're too damn trusting. Without me to protect you, you'd get kilt one of these days. Sugarplum, you coming into bed?
answer: Just a second. Grant, no -- I'm sorry, I'm just -- I'm not in the mood.

question: Come on, baby, it's --
answer: I'm sorry. I don't just have some switch.

question: Sure you do. Flip. Flip.
answer: That's disrespectful.

question: When are you in the mood, exactly? Seems to me that mood's as rare as winnin' the Goddamn lotto.
answer: Where are you going?

question: I'm just some big clown to you, ain't I?
answer: That's not true -- Where are you-?

question: Out. Hit me again there, killer. Parents thought it sounded pleasant, I s'pose. Joke on me, ain't it?
answer: Megan Halesy' little sister.

question: Shit. You're kidding me.
answer: Nope. Brenda!

question: Hell, you were --
answer: I was! And I'll tell you somethin', Grant Grant. I's in love with you. My sister Megan, she's a big fat cow. Was then, even more so now. I'd be thinking, what'd you see in her ain't in me?

question: Shit, girl, you couldn't'a been eleven.
answer: Hell, I was game!

question: Who's the lucky fella?
answer: Fuck lucky. Never marry a damn half-Mexican.

question: Already ain't. Married a gal named --
answer: Starla Covington. Don't be ignorant. Everyone knows that. Fucking prom queen.

question: Yeah.
answer: Where you goin'?

question: Starla, she gets real worried 'bout me I stay out too late. Loves me too much, that one. What the...? Hey, anybody 'round here? 'Lo? Ow! Fuck!
answer: Over here! Hey, man. You all right?... Dude?... Oh shit. I think he's d --

question: It's taking... my... brain.
answer: Buddy? You all right, man? That might of been a stroke, buddy. You better take it easy.

question: I caught a little somethin', yeah. Hey there, sugarplum.
answer: Haven't heard this for a while. I never danced in a towel before.

question: Wearing white, just like on our... wedding day. I remember it. I'm sorry about last night. I get a little insecure sometimes, want to hold on too tight. It's just 'cause you're precious to me, Starla. But I swear to God, baby, I'm turning over a new Goddamn leaf. Okay? I love you, sugarplum.
answer: Grant, what's that?

question: What are you so smiley about, girl?
answer: Oh, nothin'. Just, Grant and I had a nice morning. It's been a while.

question: Oh! You got that fresh-fucked glow, don't you?
answer: Janene.

question: You slut.
answer: Hush.

question: No shame. You're a married woman.
answer: He was... considerate. Maybe this is the start of a real change in Grant.

question: He was... considerate. Maybe this is the start of a real change in Grant.
answer: Meat. Meat. Sure thing, killer. Thinkin' 'bout getting me a couple of these big ol' rib eyes. Well... having us a little dinner party... I'd say... eight. No, no... fourteen... Hell, what am I holding back for? Why don't you just give me everything you got here? Yep. And while you're at it, get me a few of them chicken wings... some pork loins... and, ooo, what's this here? Osso buco?... Meat. You're meat. Welcome home.

question: Grant? Why are there -- did you put locks on the garage? You drilled into the driveway.
answer: Yeahhhh. I'm sorry. I just got so excited about... your present.

question: My present?
answer: You're my princess, aren't you?

question: Okay.
answer: I got a super-special birthday present for you this year. I couldn't risk you finding it, so I had to put them locks on the doors.

question: All right... I have to clean up before dinner.
answer: You're meat.

question: What?
answer: Oh, nothin'. Nothin'. See you in a sec. Meat.

question: Hey there, handsome. Must be fate, us meeting again like this.
answer: Well, you might be right... You're lookin' awful pretty.

question: Shut up.
answer: Where's the old half-Mexican?

question: Took the kids to his Mom's for the weekend. Where you takin' me, you bad boy!
answer: Take off your shirt, doll. Guess it's hard to explain how amazin' a human brain is to someone who that's all they know.

question: What?
answer: Stuff you can never imagine. Feelings. Big thoughts. And love. Yeah. I'm inclined to parlay it into somethin' more. So, go ahead there, beautiful, and take off your shirt. Nice.

question: Hey, Bill!
answer: Don't worry. The lurker ain't around. I checked.

question: That's not funny.
answer: Sorry.

question: Whatcha' doin'?
answer: Tryin' to get a buzz on. But I'm too buff. Too much muscle mass. What you up to?

question: Just checking out the lights.
answer: Pretty, ain't they?

question: I don't know. I've seen them so many times before. I guess any spot gets boring after awhile.
answer: Well that's only if you're in the wrong spot. There's a place over there on the bluffs. When the fog is just right, like tonight, the lights of Main look like a kaleidoscope.

question: Oh, yeah?
answer: Mm hm. But only a few folks know how to get there. Wally. Rollo Linkski coulda taken you, but 'course he got hit by that train. Me.

question: I'll get Wally to show me sometime then.
answer: Oh, will you now?

question: Grant, where'd you go?
answer: Hey, Grant.

question: Why'd you betray me, sugarplum?!
answer: Grant, no!

question: I loved you. I loved --
answer: Grant, you're sick!

question: I wanted you by my side, but you -- I can't trust you now!
answer: Noooo!

question: Bill!
answer: Shit.

question: Bill, we need to talk!
answer: 'Mornin', Jack.

question: Bill, this Brenda's Randy Flagg's niece. We need to find Grant yesterday! The town council has lit a Roman candle and stuck it up my ass!
answer: Hell, Jack, your leisure activities ain't my business.

question: Don't fuck with me, Bill. Your post here as Chief is in dire straits you don't work this shit out.
answer: Don't worry, we'll find him. Anything new?

question: How are you going to find him?
answer: Dude's a half-squid. Ain't many places he can hide. Sea World, maybe.

question: That young lady heard you say 'squid.' She's gonna go out and create a Goddamn hysteria!
answer: Sherry, you gonna create a hysteria?

question: Bastard obviously got lyme disease!
answer: What?

question: Touch some deer feces out in the forest. Eat a sandwich without washing your hands. Then you got lyme disease.
answer: And that makes you look like a squid?

question: Bill, I heard what you're doing. I think I should go along.
answer: Why? Listen, it doesn't matter. I gotta go.

question: Wait! Dammit, Bill, if that girl's still out there, how will you find her? How, unless you bring Grant in alive? Your best chance of doing that is with me. I can talk to him --
answer: He tried to kill you, Starla.

question: He did. I know. But I got him angry 'cause I wasn't calm. This time I could -- Please, Bill. What happened, it's my fault, I know it.
answer: Starla, it ain't --

question: We need their weight. Dumbshits. Come on! Shelby? Shelby, you there?
answer: Yo, Chief. How y'all doin'? You dig that rat out of the hole?

question: Listen, you got any reports of... I don't know what you call 'em. They look like big slugs, only fast.
answer: Slugs? No. 'Less you talkin' about that new waitress down at Sloan's! Ha ha!

question: Shelby --
answer: Oh, shit! I hope she ain't a police radio aficionado. If so, I apolog -

question: Shelby, shut up. Keep an eye out for these things. If you see 'em, keep your mouth covered. Otherwise they'll go straight down it. All right? Are you nodding?
answer: Yeah.

question: I can't hear when you're nodding.
answer: Sorry.

question: For real it looks like a needle. Its real face. But it always gots another. He goes from place to place, worlds... planets... killing 'em. He takes over half of what's alive and eats the other half. Till they're gone. Now he's here. He went in Mr. Grant.
answer: Through a wound on his stomach?

question: He took him over. His body. His -- his brain, everything what he knew. He's only been dumb stuff before - amoeba-things, and rhino-things. He liked being human. Didn't want to change.
answer: And you said the worms are part of him. They're all linked, like one creature?

question: When one sees you they all see you.
answer: An animal that doesn't procreate. It spreads, grows. A living disease.

question: Do it. Hey, Starla. Was always curious why you... married Grant in the first place... Just never seemed outta love.
answer: I know what people say, Bill. I... Remember, back in high school I worked at my father's gas station? Grant used to get filled up every day. I knew it was just to see me. He was too old -- But he was handsome. And he had that big ol' Lincoln then. I flirted with him.

question: Well, big ol' Lincoln, sure. Guess I would have flirted with him too.
answer: My father, he was -- he was real close to evil. People didn't know. Still don't. From the time I was a toddler he'd beat the hell out of me. I don't mean just like a smack for smart-mouthing... he took a real enjoyment in it. And when I turned eleven or twelve, things... well, they got worse.

question: When you wanted to run away, I called your dad.
answer: That wasn't a good night, no.

question: I'm sorry.
answer: Anyway, Grant rolls in one day. I fill his tank with like an eighth- a-gallon as usual. And he notices my lip's all swollen up, and starts asking me how it happened. I don't know why I chose then, why Grant -- I guess I saw an opportunity. And I told him everything, first time I told anyone. Grant was furious. He picked up a tire iron, walked straightaway into the garage, and beat my father half to death. You say it's not about love, Bill. But that was the closest thing to it I ever knew. Grant asked me to marry him a few weeks later. I felt... safe with him. After all this shit tonight, I know for sure now you regret not running off with me to Hollywood!

question: Shelby!
answer: Hey there, Chief.

question: Shelby! We need people out here at Cosgrove and McCammon right away!
answer: Don't worry, Chief. Already on our way.

question: This is stupid.
answer: What are you doing?!

question: We can't make it. Just get away, when you get the chance.
answer: What?

question: He wants me, Bill! I'm going to get him to take me to him! See if you can follow me, and kill him!
answer: No, Starla! No! Nooo!

question: Grant?
answer: Grant keeps his back to her. Starla takes in the room. Photographs from their scrapbooks are all over the walls

question: Hey, Grant. You did some real interesting decorating here. Hey. Look, the sun's starting to come up.
answer: Grant SCREECHES angrily at Starla. She quickly closes the drapes, not letting on she saw Bill.

question: Sorry. I didn't -- I didn't know you wanted it dark.
answer: Starla tries to change the subject by walking to a wall with the photos.

question: You like these memories, huh, Grant? You like being called Grant, don't you? I think you do. You really do. You like being Grant. Like when we danced. And when you... made love to me here on the bed. Remember that? I know you've been alone, Grant. Almost forever. From here to there to there to here, there's never been another one for you. Grant. Grant, I could help you. Be with you the way you want. See, I want to live. I've never had much use for this world, not really. You and I, together, we -- You don't trust me, I know. That's why I brought you someone, Grant. It's Bill. He's in the house next door. Just look.
answer: Grant looks at Starla with sad eyes, perhaps touched. Starla smiles nervously, expectantly.

question: See? I brought him here for you! As an offering! To prove I love you more than him!
answer: Starla moves slowly in toward Grant, as if to kiss him. Grant looks, well, joyful.

question: Now, Bill!! Kill the motherfucker!!
answer: The WINDOW SHATTERS and the shot strikes Grant. He SCREECHES, swinging his tentacles aimlessly around the room in fury. Grant is struck in the head. He starts slithering out of the bedroom, feeling his way out.
